title: Bug 7785 - SaveAs Forgets the file type
description: The icon has also changed from the parent javafile icon to a generic file icon.
OB:
After performing the following steps:
1) Open an existing java file
2) Modify the file (e.g., move an existing class)
3) Click the SaveAs icon, located next to the Save Icon
A dialog box is displayed.
4) Browse for a valid container location
5) Enter the filename without specifying the file extension
6) Click the 'Ok' button
The file is added to the specified location in the Navigator pane, but no file extension is displayed.
EB: The file type should be retained when using the SaveAs function, and the file should be displayed with the appropriate file extension in the Navigator pane.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1) Open an existing java file
2) Modify the file (e.g., move an existing class)
3) Click the SaveAs icon, located next to the Save Icon
A dialog box is displayed.
4) Browse for a valid container location
5) Enter the filename without specifying the file extension
6) Click the 'Ok' button
Verify that the file is added to the specified location in the Navigator pane without the file extension displayed.
